result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Lamar Vance Sr

records.addlTxt:
8:58 AM Defendant Carlos Lamar Vance Sr in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Carlos Lamar Vance Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Court addresses violation report on file in regards to SCRAM. 
Defense gives statement as to report and requests there not be action taken, requests one more status date. 
State indicates any further violation of bond will result in the offer being revoked.
BTC: Court will not take action on bond today. Matter set over for plea hearing.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing on January 20, 2023 at 09:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report

8:54 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos Lamar Vance Sr in court.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Carlos Lamar Vance Sr. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates they are looking to see if this may amended to an OWI 7th. 
State confirms and requests this be set over to Oct to get this worked out. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. Must Install IID Device. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

AMENDED 5/31/2022 to include that the defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.**

9:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos Lamar Vance Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Carlos Lamar Vance Sr. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests bond be reduced to $1000 and gives further statement as to request. 
State objects to modification and gives statement as to why. 
BTC: Bond will be modified to include SCRAM but keep monetary amount.
Received 05/18/22
Bail/bond hearing on May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defense
State's NOI to Introduce Certified Public Records
State's NOI to Introduce Expert Testimony
State's Notice of Intent to Introduce 911 Recordings
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE
NG plea entered.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos Lamar Vance Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan in court for Carlos Lamar Vance Sr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all. Must Install IID Device. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Carlos Lamar Vance Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Carlos Lamar Vance Sr. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
